meanings.definition: Having a surface that is uneven or not smooth.
meanings.sent1: The roughest road in town is full of bumps and holes.
meanings.sent2: The roughest sandpaper is used to smooth out rough surfaces.
meanings.sent3: The roughest blanket felt like a pile of rocks instead of soft fabric.
meanings.sent4: Her roughest drawing resembled a scribble more than a picture.
meanings.sent5: The roughest fabric was so scratchy it felt like wearing sandpaper.

meanings.sent1: The roughest storm we've ever experienced knocked down trees and power lines.
meanings.sent2: Facing the roughest challenge of his life, he didn't give up.
meanings.sent3: The roughest math problem made her head spin with confusion.
meanings.sent4: Their roughest argument ended with hurt feelings and tears.
meanings.sent5: The roughest decision she had to make was whether to move away from her family.

meanings.definition: Characterized by harsh or violent behavior.
meanings.sent1: The roughest kids in the neighborhood were always causing trouble.
meanings.sent2: The roughest criminals were finally caught by the police.
meanings.sent3: His roughest tone of voice scared the little puppy.
meanings.sent4: The roughest seas tossed the boat around like a toy.
meanings.sent5: The roughest bullies at school made others feel scared and unsafe.
